title: Landlords' woes are just a blip – here's why buy-to-let will rise again
text:
The past 11 years have been a challenge for landlords in anyone’s book. When you compare the post credit crunch market to the booming early and mid-2000s, the difference is stark.

Then, people were clamouring to jump on the buy-to-let bandwagon, house prices were rising, lending was flexible and government and regulatory intervention was infrequent to say the least.

Now, some landlords are leaving the sector, others are putting a halt on expansion, house prices are stuttering and the red tape just keeps on tightening, squeezing landlords’ profit a little further with each new measure.
